description.narrative: Cote D'Ivoire was plunged into turmoil following a contested presidential election in November 2010. The crisis led to a serious disruption in school activities. Schools were damaged and looted and the education system was severely affected. Funding under this initiative supports the Cote D'Ivoire School Rehabilitation Project through UNICEF, specifically to help rehabilitate 40 schools and support the return of children to school in crisis affected areas in Moyen Cavally. The support will also help fund the purchasing and distribution of school equipment and teaching materials for students and teachers. The total value of this initiative is $0.5 million over one year, 2011-12.
